73  /**
74   * Test class for the Store
75   */
76  @Category(MediumTests.class)
77  public class TestStore extends TestCase {
78    public static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(TestStore.class);
79  
80    Store store;
81    byte [] table = Bytes.toBytes("table");
82    byte [] family = Bytes.toBytes("family");
83  
84    byte [] row = Bytes.toBytes("row");
85    byte [] row2 = Bytes.toBytes("row2");
86    byte [] qf1 = Bytes.toBytes("qf1");
87    byte [] qf2 = Bytes.toBytes("qf2");
88    byte [] qf3 = Bytes.toBytes("qf3");
89    byte [] qf4 = Bytes.toBytes("qf4");
90    byte [] qf5 = Bytes.toBytes("qf5");
91    byte [] qf6 = Bytes.toBytes("qf6");
92  
93    NavigableSet<byte[]> qualifiers =
94      new ConcurrentSkipListSet<byte[]>(Bytes.BYTES_COMPARATOR);
95  
96    List<KeyValue> expected = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
97    List<KeyValue> result = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
98  
99    long id = System.currentTimeMillis();
100   Get get = new Get(row);
101 
102   private HBaseTestingUtility TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility();
103   private final String DIR = TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir("TestStore").toString();
104 
105 
106   /**
107    * Setup
108    * @throws IOException
109    */
110   @Override
111   public void setUp() throws IOException {
112     qualifiers.add(qf1);
113     qualifiers.add(qf3);
114     qualifiers.add(qf5);
115 
116     Iterator<byte[]> iter = qualifiers.iterator();
117     while(iter.hasNext()){
118       byte [] next = iter.next();
119       expected.add(new KeyValue(row, family, next, 1, (byte[])null));
120       get.addColumn(family, next);
121     }
122   }
123 
124   private void init(String methodName) throws IOException {
125     init(methodName, HBaseConfiguration.create());
126   }
127 
128   private void init(String methodName, Configuration conf)
129   throws IOException {
130     HColumnDescriptor hcd = new HColumnDescriptor(family);
131     // some of the tests write 4 versions and then flush
132     // (with HBASE-4241, lower versions are collected on flush)
133     hcd.setMaxVersions(4);
134     init(methodName, conf, hcd);
135   }
136 
137   private void init(String methodName, Configuration conf,
138       HColumnDescriptor hcd) throws IOException {
139     //Setting up a Store
140     Path basedir = new Path(DIR+methodName);
141     Path logdir = new Path(DIR+methodName+"/logs");
142     Path oldLogDir = new Path(basedir, HConstants.HREGION_OLDLOGDIR_NAME);
143     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
144 
145     fs.delete(logdir, true);
146 
147     HTableDescriptor htd = new HTableDescriptor(table);
148     htd.addFamily(hcd);
149     HRegionInfo info = new HRegionInfo(htd.getName(), null, null, false);
150     HLog hlog = new HLog(fs, logdir, oldLogDir, conf);
151     HRegion region = new HRegion(basedir, hlog, fs, conf, info, htd, null);
152 
153     store = new Store(basedir, region, hcd, fs, conf);
154   }
155 
156   /**
157    * Verify that compression and data block encoding are respected by the
158    * Store.createWriterInTmp() method, used on store flush.
159    */
160   public void testCreateWriter() throws Exception {
161     Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
162     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
163 
164     HColumnDescriptor hcd = new HColumnDescriptor(family);
165     hcd.setCompressionType(Compression.Algorithm.GZ);
166     hcd.setDataBlockEncoding(DataBlockEncoding.DIFF);
167     init(getName(), conf, hcd);
168 
169     // Test createWriterInTmp()
170     StoreFile.Writer writer = store.createWriterInTmp(4, hcd.getCompression(), false);
171     Path path = writer.getPath();
172     writer.append(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, Bytes.toBytes(1)));
173     writer.append(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, Bytes.toBytes(2)));
174     writer.append(new KeyValue(row2, family, qf1, Bytes.toBytes(3)));
175     writer.append(new KeyValue(row2, family, qf2, Bytes.toBytes(4)));
176     writer.close();
177 
178     // Verify that compression and encoding settings are respected
179     HFile.Reader reader = HFile.createReader(fs, path, new CacheConfig(conf));
180     assertEquals(hcd.getCompressionType(), reader.getCompressionAlgorithm());
181     assertEquals(hcd.getDataBlockEncoding(), reader.getEncodingOnDisk());
182     reader.close();
183   }
184 
185   public void testDeleteExpiredStoreFiles() throws Exception {
186     int storeFileNum = 4;
187     int ttl = 4;
188 
189     Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
190     // Enable the expired store file deletion
191     conf.setBoolean("hbase.store.delete.expired.storefile", true);
192     HColumnDescriptor hcd = new HColumnDescriptor(family);
193     hcd.setTimeToLive(ttl);
194     init(getName(), conf, hcd);
195 
196     long sleepTime = this.store.scanInfo.getTtl() / storeFileNum;
197     long timeStamp;
198     // There are 4 store files and the max time stamp difference among these
199     // store files will be (this.store.ttl / storeFileNum)
200     for (int i = 1; i <= storeFileNum; i++) {
201       LOG.info("Adding some data for the store file #" + i);
202       timeStamp = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
203       this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, timeStamp, (byte[]) null));
204       this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, timeStamp, (byte[]) null));
205       this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf3, timeStamp, (byte[]) null));
206       flush(i);
207       Thread.sleep(sleepTime);
208     }
209 
210     // Verify the total number of store files
211     assertEquals(storeFileNum, this.store.getStorefiles().size());
212 
213     // Each compaction request will find one expired store file and delete it
214     // by the compaction.
215     for (int i = 1; i <= storeFileNum; i++) {
216       // verify the expired store file.
217       CompactionRequest cr = this.store.requestCompaction();
218       assertEquals(1, cr.getFiles().size());
219       assertTrue(cr.getFiles().get(0).getReader().getMaxTimestamp() <
220           (System.currentTimeMillis() - this.store.scanInfo.getTtl()));
221       // Verify that the expired the store has been deleted.
222       this.store.compact(cr);
223       assertEquals(storeFileNum - i, this.store.getStorefiles().size());
224 
225       // Let the next store file expired.
226       Thread.sleep(sleepTime);
227     }
228   }
229 
230   public void testLowestModificationTime() throws Exception {
231     Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
232     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
233     // Initialize region
234     init(getName(), conf);
235 
236     int storeFileNum = 4;
237     for (int i = 1; i <= storeFileNum; i++) {
238       LOG.info("Adding some data for the store file #"+i);
239       this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, i, (byte[])null));
240       this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, i, (byte[])null));
241       this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf3, i, (byte[])null));
242       flush(i);
243     }
244     // after flush; check the lowest time stamp
245     long lowestTimeStampFromStore =
246         Store.getLowestTimestamp(store.getStorefiles());
247     long lowestTimeStampFromFS =
248       getLowestTimeStampFromFS(fs,store.getStorefiles());
249     assertEquals(lowestTimeStampFromStore,lowestTimeStampFromFS);
250 
251     // after compact; check the lowest time stamp
252     store.compact(store.requestCompaction());
253     lowestTimeStampFromStore = Store.getLowestTimestamp(store.getStorefiles());
254     lowestTimeStampFromFS = getLowestTimeStampFromFS(fs,store.getStorefiles());
255     assertEquals(lowestTimeStampFromStore,lowestTimeStampFromFS);
256   }
257 
258   private static long getLowestTimeStampFromFS(FileSystem fs,
259       final List<StoreFile> candidates) throws IOException {
260     long minTs = Long.MAX_VALUE;
261     if (candidates.isEmpty()) {
262       return minTs;
263     }
264     Path[] p = new Path[candidates.size()];
265     for (int i = 0; i < candidates.size(); ++i) {
266       p[i] = candidates.get(i).getPath();
267     }
268 
269     FileStatus[] stats = fs.listStatus(p);
270     if (stats == null || stats.length == 0) {
271       return minTs;
272     }
273     for (FileStatus s : stats) {
274       minTs = Math.min(minTs, s.getModificationTime());
275     }
276     return minTs;
277   }

283   /**
284    * Test for hbase-1686.
285    * @throws IOException
286    */
287   public void testEmptyStoreFile() throws IOException {
288     init(this.getName());
289     // Write a store file.
290     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, 1, (byte[])null));
291     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, 1, (byte[])null));
292     flush(1);
293     // Now put in place an empty store file.  Its a little tricky.  Have to
294     // do manually with hacked in sequence id.
295     StoreFile f = this.store.getStorefiles().get(0);
296     Path storedir = f.getPath().getParent();
297     long seqid = f.getMaxSequenceId();
298     Configuration c = HBaseConfiguration.create();
299     FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(c);
300     StoreFile.Writer w = new StoreFile.WriterBuilder(c, new CacheConfig(c),
301         fs, StoreFile.DEFAULT_BLOCKSIZE_SMALL)
302             .withOutputDir(storedir)
303             .build();
304     w.appendMetadata(seqid + 1, false);
305     w.close();
306     this.store.close();
307     // Reopen it... should pick up two files
308     this.store = new Store(storedir.getParent().getParent(),
309       this.store.getHRegion(),
310       this.store.getFamily(), fs, c);
311     System.out.println(this.store.getHRegionInfo().getEncodedName());
312     assertEquals(2, this.store.getStorefilesCount());
313 
314     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store,
315         get.getRow(),
316         qualifiers);
317     assertEquals(1, result.size());
318   }
319 
320   /**
321    * Getting data from memstore only
322    * @throws IOException
323    */
324   public void testGet_FromMemStoreOnly() throws IOException {
325     init(this.getName());
326 
327     //Put data in memstore
328     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, 1, (byte[])null));
329     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, 1, (byte[])null));
330     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf3, 1, (byte[])null));
331     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf4, 1, (byte[])null));
332     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf5, 1, (byte[])null));
333     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf6, 1, (byte[])null));
334 
335     //Get
336     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store,
337         get.getRow(), qualifiers);
338 
339     //Compare
340     assertCheck();
341   }
342 
343   /**
344    * Getting data from files only
345    * @throws IOException
346    */
347   public void testGet_FromFilesOnly() throws IOException {
348     init(this.getName());
349 
350     //Put data in memstore
351     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, 1, (byte[])null));
352     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, 1, (byte[])null));
353     //flush
354     flush(1);
355 
356     //Add more data
357     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf3, 1, (byte[])null));
358     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf4, 1, (byte[])null));
359     //flush
360     flush(2);
361 
362     //Add more data
363     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf5, 1, (byte[])null));
364     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf6, 1, (byte[])null));
365     //flush
366     flush(3);
367 
368     //Get
369     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store,
370         get.getRow(),
371         qualifiers);
372     //this.store.get(get, qualifiers, result);
373 
374     //Need to sort the result since multiple files
375     Collections.sort(result, KeyValue.COMPARATOR);
376 
377     //Compare
378     assertCheck();
379   }

381   /**
382    * Getting data from memstore and files
383    * @throws IOException
384    */
385   public void testGet_FromMemStoreAndFiles() throws IOException {
386     init(this.getName());
387 
388     //Put data in memstore
389     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, 1, (byte[])null));
390     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, 1, (byte[])null));
391     //flush
392     flush(1);
393 
394     //Add more data
395     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf3, 1, (byte[])null));
396     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf4, 1, (byte[])null));
397     //flush
398     flush(2);
399 
400     //Add more data
401     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf5, 1, (byte[])null));
402     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf6, 1, (byte[])null));
403 
404     //Get
405     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store,
406         get.getRow(), qualifiers);
407 
408     //Need to sort the result since multiple files
409     Collections.sort(result, KeyValue.COMPARATOR);
410 
411     //Compare
412     assertCheck();
413   }
414 
415   private void flush(int storeFilessize) throws IOException{
416     this.store.snapshot();
417     flushStore(store, id++);
418     assertEquals(storeFilessize, this.store.getStorefiles().size());
419     assertEquals(0, this.store.memstore.kvset.size());
420   }
421 
422   private void assertCheck() {
423     assertEquals(expected.size(), result.size());
424     for(int i=0; i<expected.size(); i++) {
425       assertEquals(expected.get(i), result.get(i));
426     }
427   }
428 
429   //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
430   // IncrementColumnValue tests
431   //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
432   /*
433    * test the internal details of how ICV works, especially during a flush scenario.
434    */
435   public void testIncrementColumnValue_ICVDuringFlush()
436       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
437     init(this.getName());
438 
439     long oldValue = 1L;
440     long newValue = 3L;
441     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1,
442         System.currentTimeMillis(),
443         Bytes.toBytes(oldValue)));
444 
445     // snapshot the store.
446     this.store.snapshot();
447 
448     // add other things:
449     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2,
450         System.currentTimeMillis(),
451         Bytes.toBytes(oldValue)));
452 
453     // update during the snapshot.
454     long ret = this.store.updateColumnValue(row, family, qf1, newValue);
455 
456     // memstore should have grown by some amount.
457     assertTrue(ret > 0);
458 
459     // then flush.
460     flushStore(store, id++);
461     assertEquals(1, this.store.getStorefiles().size());
462     // from the one we inserted up there, and a new one
463     assertEquals(2, this.store.memstore.kvset.size());
464 
465     // how many key/values for this row are there?
466     Get get = new Get(row);
467     get.addColumn(family, qf1);
468     get.setMaxVersions(); // all versions.
469     List<KeyValue> results = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
470 
471     results = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
472     assertEquals(2, results.size());
473 
474     long ts1 = results.get(0).getTimestamp();
475     long ts2 = results.get(1).getTimestamp();
476 
477     assertTrue(ts1 > ts2);
478 
479     assertEquals(newValue, Bytes.toLong(results.get(0).getValue()));
480     assertEquals(oldValue, Bytes.toLong(results.get(1).getValue()));
481   }
482 
483   @Override
484   protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
485     super.tearDown();
486     EnvironmentEdgeManagerTestHelper.reset();
487   }
488 
489   public void testICV_negMemstoreSize()  throws IOException {
490       init(this.getName());
491 
492     long time = 100;
493     ManualEnvironmentEdge ee = new ManualEnvironmentEdge();
494     ee.setValue(time);
495     EnvironmentEdgeManagerTestHelper.injectEdge(ee);
496     long newValue = 3L;
497     long size = 0;
498 
499 
500     size += this.store.add(new KeyValue(Bytes.toBytes("200909091000"), family, qf1,
501         System.currentTimeMillis(),
502         Bytes.toBytes(newValue)));
503     size += this.store.add(new KeyValue(Bytes.toBytes("200909091200"), family, qf1,
504         System.currentTimeMillis(),
505         Bytes.toBytes(newValue)));
506     size += this.store.add(new KeyValue(Bytes.toBytes("200909091300"), family, qf1,
507         System.currentTimeMillis(),
508         Bytes.toBytes(newValue)));
509     size += this.store.add(new KeyValue(Bytes.toBytes("200909091400"), family, qf1,
510         System.currentTimeMillis(),
511         Bytes.toBytes(newValue)));
512     size += this.store.add(new KeyValue(Bytes.toBytes("200909091500"), family, qf1,
513         System.currentTimeMillis(),
514         Bytes.toBytes(newValue)));
515 
516 
517     for ( int i = 0 ; i < 10000 ; ++i) {
518       newValue++;
519 
520       long ret = this.store.updateColumnValue(row, family, qf1, newValue);
521       long ret2 = this.store.updateColumnValue(row2, family, qf1, newValue);
522 
523       if (ret != 0) System.out.println("ret: " + ret);
524       if (ret2 != 0) System.out.println("ret2: " + ret2);
525 
526       assertTrue("ret: " + ret, ret >= 0);
527       size += ret;
528       assertTrue("ret2: " + ret2, ret2 >= 0);
529       size += ret2;
530 
531 
532       if (i % 1000 == 0)
533         ee.setValue(++time);
534     }
535 
536     long computedSize=0;
537     for (KeyValue kv : this.store.memstore.kvset) {
538       long kvsize = this.store.memstore.heapSizeChange(kv, true);
539       //System.out.println(kv + " size= " + kvsize + " kvsize= " + kv.heapSize());
540       computedSize += kvsize;
541     }
542     assertEquals(computedSize, size);
543   }
544 
545   public void testIncrementColumnValue_SnapshotFlushCombo() throws Exception {
546     ManualEnvironmentEdge mee = new ManualEnvironmentEdge();
547     EnvironmentEdgeManagerTestHelper.injectEdge(mee);
548     init(this.getName());
549 
550     long oldValue = 1L;
551     long newValue = 3L;
552     this.store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1,
553         EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis(),
554         Bytes.toBytes(oldValue)));
555 
556     // snapshot the store.
557     this.store.snapshot();
558 
559     // update during the snapshot, the exact same TS as the Put (lololol)
560     long ret = this.store.updateColumnValue(row, family, qf1, newValue);
561 
562     // memstore should have grown by some amount.
563     assertTrue(ret > 0);
564 
565     // then flush.
566     flushStore(store, id++);
567     assertEquals(1, this.store.getStorefiles().size());
568     assertEquals(1, this.store.memstore.kvset.size());
569 
570     // now increment again:
571     newValue += 1;
572     this.store.updateColumnValue(row, family, qf1, newValue);
573 
574     // at this point we have a TS=1 in snapshot, and a TS=2 in kvset, so increment again:
575     newValue += 1;
576     this.store.updateColumnValue(row, family, qf1, newValue);
577 
578     // the second TS should be TS=2 or higher., even though 'time=1' right now.
579 
580 
581     // how many key/values for this row are there?
582     Get get = new Get(row);
583     get.addColumn(family, qf1);
584     get.setMaxVersions(); // all versions.
585     List<KeyValue> results = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
586 
587     results = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
588     assertEquals(2, results.size());
589 
590     long ts1 = results.get(0).getTimestamp();
591     long ts2 = results.get(1).getTimestamp();
592 
593     assertTrue(ts1 > ts2);
594     assertEquals(newValue, Bytes.toLong(results.get(0).getValue()));
595     assertEquals(oldValue, Bytes.toLong(results.get(1).getValue()));
596 
597     mee.setValue(2); // time goes up slightly
598     newValue += 1;
599     this.store.updateColumnValue(row, family, qf1, newValue);
600 
601     results = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
602     assertEquals(2, results.size());
603 
604     ts1 = results.get(0).getTimestamp();
605     ts2 = results.get(1).getTimestamp();
606 
607     assertTrue(ts1 > ts2);
608     assertEquals(newValue, Bytes.toLong(results.get(0).getValue()));
609     assertEquals(oldValue, Bytes.toLong(results.get(1).getValue()));
610   }
611 
612   public void testHandleErrorsInFlush() throws Exception {
613     LOG.info("Setting up a faulty file system that cannot write");
614 
615     final Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
616     User user = User.createUserForTesting(conf,
617         "testhandleerrorsinflush", new String[]{"foo"});
618     // Inject our faulty LocalFileSystem
619     conf.setClass("fs.file.impl", FaultyFileSystem.class,
620         FileSystem.class);
621     user.runAs(new PrivilegedExceptionAction<Object>() {
622       public Object run() throws Exception {
623         // Make sure it worked (above is sensitive to caching details in hadoop core)
624         FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
625         assertEquals(FaultyFileSystem.class, fs.getClass());
626 
627         // Initialize region
628         init(getName(), conf);
629 
630         LOG.info("Adding some data");
631         store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf1, 1, (byte[])null));
632         store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf2, 1, (byte[])null));
633         store.add(new KeyValue(row, family, qf3, 1, (byte[])null));
634 
635         LOG.info("Before flush, we should have no files");
636         FileStatus[] files = fs.listStatus(store.getHomedir());
637         Path[] paths = FileUtil.stat2Paths(files);
638         System.err.println("Got paths: " + Joiner.on(",").join(paths));
639         assertEquals(0, paths.length);
640 
641         //flush
642         try {
643           LOG.info("Flushing");
644           flush(1);
645           fail("Didn't bubble up IOE!");
646         } catch (IOException ioe) {
647           assertTrue(ioe.getMessage().contains("Fault injected"));
648         }
649 
650         LOG.info("After failed flush, we should still have no files!");
651         files = fs.listStatus(store.getHomedir());
652         paths = FileUtil.stat2Paths(files);
653         System.err.println("Got paths: " + Joiner.on(",").join(paths));
654         assertEquals(0, paths.length);
655         return null;
656       }
657     });
658   }
659 
660 
661   static class FaultyFileSystem extends FilterFileSystem {
662     List<SoftReference<FaultyOutputStream>> outStreams =
663       new ArrayList<SoftReference<FaultyOutputStream>>();
664     private long faultPos = 200;
665 
666     public FaultyFileSystem() {
667       super(new LocalFileSystem());
668       System.err.println("Creating faulty!");
669     }
670 
671     @Override
672     public FSDataOutputStream create(Path p) throws IOException {
673       return new FaultyOutputStream(super.create(p), faultPos);
674     }
675 
676     @Override
677     public FSDataOutputStream create(Path f, FsPermission permission,
678         boolean overwrite, int bufferSize, short replication, long blockSize,
679         Progressable progress) throws IOException {
680       return new FaultyOutputStream(super.create(f, permission,
681           overwrite, bufferSize, replication, blockSize, progress), faultPos);
682     }
683 
684     public FSDataOutputStream createNonRecursive(Path f, boolean overwrite,
685         int bufferSize, short replication, long blockSize, Progressable progress)
686     throws IOException {
687       // Fake it.  Call create instead.  The default implementation throws an IOE
688       // that this is not supported.
689       return create(f, overwrite, bufferSize, replication, blockSize, progress);
690     }
691   }
692 
693   static class FaultyOutputStream extends FSDataOutputStream {
694     volatile long faultPos = Long.MAX_VALUE;
695 
696     public FaultyOutputStream(FSDataOutputStream out,
697         long faultPos) throws IOException {
698       super(out, null);
699       this.faultPos = faultPos;
700     }
701 
702     @Override
703     public void write(byte[] buf, int offset, int length) throws IOException {
704       System.err.println("faulty stream write at pos " + getPos());
705       injectFault();
706       super.write(buf, offset, length);
707     }
708 
709     private void injectFault() throws IOException {
710       if (getPos() >= faultPos) {
711         throw new IOException("Fault injected");
712       }
713     }
714   }
715 
716 
717 
718   private static void flushStore(Store store, long id) throws IOException {
719     StoreFlusher storeFlusher = store.getStoreFlusher(id);
720     storeFlusher.prepare();
721     storeFlusher.flushCache(Mockito.mock(MonitoredTask.class));
722     storeFlusher.commit(Mockito.mock(MonitoredTask.class));
723   }
724 
725 
726 
727   /**
728    * Generate a list of KeyValues for testing based on given parameters
729    * @param timestamps
730    * @param numRows
731    * @param qualifier
732    * @param family
733    * @return
734    */
735   List<KeyValue> getKeyValueSet(long[] timestamps, int numRows,
736       byte[] qualifier, byte[] family) {
737     List<KeyValue> kvList = new ArrayList<KeyValue>();
738     for (int i=1;i<=numRows;i++) {
739       byte[] b = Bytes.toBytes(i);
740       for (long timestamp: timestamps) {
741         kvList.add(new KeyValue(b, family, qualifier, timestamp, b));
742       }
743     }
744     return kvList;
745   }
746 
747   /**
748    * Test to ensure correctness when using Stores with multiple timestamps
749    * @throws IOException
750    */
751   public void testMultipleTimestamps() throws IOException {
752     int numRows = 1;
753     long[] timestamps1 = new long[] {1,5,10,20};
754     long[] timestamps2 = new long[] {30,80};
755 
756     init(this.getName());
757 
758     List<KeyValue> kvList1 = getKeyValueSet(timestamps1,numRows, qf1, family);
759     for (KeyValue kv : kvList1) {
760       this.store.add(kv);
761     }
762 
763     this.store.snapshot();
764     flushStore(store, id++);
765 
766     List<KeyValue> kvList2 = getKeyValueSet(timestamps2,numRows, qf1, family);
767     for(KeyValue kv : kvList2) {
768       this.store.add(kv);
769     }
770 
771     List<KeyValue> result;
772     Get get = new Get(Bytes.toBytes(1));
773     get.addColumn(family,qf1);
774 
775     get.setTimeRange(0,15);
776     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
777     assertTrue(result.size()>0);
778 
779     get.setTimeRange(40,90);
780     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
781     assertTrue(result.size()>0);
782 
783     get.setTimeRange(10,45);
784     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
785     assertTrue(result.size()>0);
786 
787     get.setTimeRange(80,145);
788     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
789     assertTrue(result.size()>0);
790 
791     get.setTimeRange(1,2);
792     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
793     assertTrue(result.size()>0);
794 
795     get.setTimeRange(90,200);
796     result = HBaseTestingUtility.getFromStoreFile(store, get);
797     assertTrue(result.size()==0);
798   }
799 
800   /**
801    * Test for HBASE-3492 - Test split on empty colfam (no store files).
802    *
803    * @throws IOException When the IO operations fail.
804    */
805   public void testSplitWithEmptyColFam() throws IOException {
806     init(this.getName());
807     assertNull(store.getSplitPoint());
808     store.getHRegion().forceSplit(null);
809     assertNull(store.getSplitPoint());
810     store.getHRegion().clearSplit_TESTS_ONLY();
811   }
